.class public auto ansi sealed BehaviorDragDropEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub BehaviorDragDropEventHandler(sender As Object, e As BehaviorDragDropEventArgs)
public delegate void BehaviorDragDropEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, BehaviorDragDropEventArgs ^ e);
type BehaviorDragDropEventHandler = delegate of obj * BehaviorDragDropEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the methods that will handle the and events of a . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorDragDropEventHandler> delegate, you identify a method to handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
